meanings.definition: To strike a blow or forceful hit.
meanings.sent1: He tried to knockdown the door with his shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a powerful knockdown punch.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to knockdown the tower of blocks.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a knockdown blow to his ego.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds could knockdown trees easily.

meanings.sent3: The knockdown sale made everyone rush to buy items.
meanings.sent4: The knockdown in prices left the competitors struggling to keep up.
meanings.sent5: The knockdown offer was too good to resist.
